sessions.name: Workshop Energy Management
sessions.description: It all seems very simple, but yet few people manage to 'manage' their energy levels properly.  How are you doing now? What are your signals of an empty battery? Especially when things are going well, it is important to invest in this. That's what we're going to do. Self-reflection and making steps. So you can continue to shine, at home and at work!

sessions.name: Front-end applications after the micro-services era
sessions.description: Creating front-end applications these days is not just throw a single page application on top of microservices? What happens when your application is getting bigger? Just add more developers is the right solution? oh yeah!!! Components are going further. Join my talk and learn more about this!

sessions.name: A rotten statue and the European nineteenth century
sessions.description: There is an old Dutch saying ‘Dat is naatje!’, which means as much as ‘That’s screwed up’ or ‘That’s useless’. This saying referred to the statue Eendracht der Hollandsche Natie or Naatje for short. In this talk we will discuss why this statue is perfect to explain the much of the nineteenth century and why people associated the statue with failure.

sessions.name: Why the F*** do you work?
sessions.description: An interactive session about why people choose to work.

sessions.name: Introduction to DevOps with Lego, Chocolate and a Scrum game
sessions.description: You will learn about the DevOps mindset through games and chocolate.

sessions.name: Minimalism - Decrease complexity and improve quality at life and work
sessions.description: In this session, Yolanda will explain the Minimalism concept, a lifestyle which many claim promotes increased personal satisfaction. When applied at work, minimalism can make you more productive and improve the quality of what you deliver, and that’s the power of MVP. In addition, Yolanda will take you step by step through frameworks which you can apply this concept in your life and work.

sessions.name: Agile workshop / game
sessions.description: What are the agile values and principles? How can we encourage self-organisation and improve the way we work as a team? We will discover answers to these questions and much more by playing a serious fun and colorful game with talented people.

sessions.name: Lightning Decision Jam workshop
sessions.description: A means of quickly-solving complex problems, this workshop can be applied in small team project team settings to corporate strategy meetings, and beyond. It is a method of getting maximum productivity from people with differing views.

sessions.name: System thinking and aquaponics
sessions.description: System thinking is the way of thinking that is at the foundation of agile development frameworks like lean and scrum. In this talk I will use my aquaponics system as an example to explain what systems thinking really is about.

sessions.name: Spotting & closing opportunities 101 - how to spot and create sales opportunities if you are not ‘in sales’
sessions.description: Do you want to know more about the sales process? Knowing a bit more on how to sell is useful in many of life’s situations!  In the first 30 minutes I’ll share 5 things that are absolutely essential to know. And after that you will experience a sales conversation hands on - so you can put your new skill into practise right away. In the process I’ll also share what changed my (developers) point of view on sales completely 7 years ago. See you at the academy day!

sessions.name: Shakespearean insults workshop
sessions.description: And now for something completely different… get up, get moving and learn how to hurl insults with the bold belligerence of The Bard while practicing intonation and delivery. Old English may not be a programming language, but it’s anything but dead. Workshop format; be prepared to participate!

sessions.name: Mutation testing
sessions.description: Mutation testing is conceptually quite simple. Faults (or mutations) are automatically seeded into your code, then your tests are run. If your tests fail then the mutation is killed, if your tests pass then the mutation lived. The quality of your tests can be gauged from the percentage of mutations killed.

sessions.name: Lessons from eight months of teaching
sessions.description: Why did I want to do this again? I forget my reason for becoming a teacher, but I will never forget the journey. It's given me a new appreciation for the teachers I've had in my life, and so many other intangible things I had no idea about. It's put so many things in perspective and I've only just scratched the surface. I'd like to share what I've learned.

sessions.name: Case study about IFS
sessions.description: A retro of IFS, mentioning some of the things which we have found really useful such as the external and internal user testing as well as some of the things which haven't went as well and what we would do differently if we could start the project from scratch.

sessions.name: Using game principles to engage users
sessions.description: Gamification has been a bit of a buzzword the past few years, but the buzz has silenced a little. However, gamification is still very much alive. It’s the practice of adding gaming principles to applications to engage and persuade users, which we sometimes already implement without realising it’s gamification. I’d like to introduce you to some basic principles and how they can be applied.

sessions.name: Web Summit recap
sessions.description: César will talk about some of the talks and topics he visited during the Web Summit in Lisbon.

sessions.name: Hack Yourself Before You Wreck Yourself
sessions.description: A security mistake is easily made. You forget to lock your screen and as consequence, you're buying pizza for the whole office. These are security  mistakes we are aware of. The challenge lies in identify the mistakes that we aren't aware of. In our presentation we will take a step back and look at what security really is about. In the end, we want to test your security knowledge and honesty with a quiz!
